rydougherty15@alumni.davidson.edu, 301 252 0539
Education
Davidson College, B.A. Economics Aug 2011—May 2015
• Major GPA: 3.7, Cumulative GPA: 3.4
• Relevant Courses: International Finance, Econometrics, Statistics, Intermediate Microeconomics,
Intermediate Macroeconomics, Programming, Game Theory, and Politics of Development
London School of Economics, General Course Sept 2013—June 2014
• Honors: 2:1
• Courses: Economic Policy Analysis, Africa and the World Economy, Economics in Public Policy,
and Introduction to Financial and Managerial Accounting
Work Experience
Calvert Investments, Relationship Management Intern May 2013—Aug 2014
• Mapped out the entire distribution network of Calvert funds, by looking at the fees charged to
particular share classes of funds on separate platforms
• Created distinct models to project how proposed fee increases would affect Calvert
• Developed and analyzed reports detailing sales trends with different Broker Dealers
• Worked with the Legal Department to create a database of active sales agreements between
Calvert and other firms
• Created reports tracking the Relationship Management and Marketing Department’s financial
situation and budget
• Researched the financial statements of focus firms
• Produced monthly reports displaying regional sales data of different Calvert funds
Congressman Ed Perlmutter, Summer Intern June 2010—Aug 2010
• Researched current issues and helped to produce newsletters
• Worked on constituent services during a congressional election year
• Attended hearings on behalf of the office, and worked to enter sets of data
Racquet and Jog, Sales Representative Aug 2010—Aug 2012
• Specialized in custom fitting shoes and athletic gear for runners
Skills and Research
• Proficient in Stata, Python, and Microsoft Office, including Excel
• Intermediate Chinese
• Econometric Analysis of inefficiencies created through ISI; how domestic debt disturbs optimal
seigniorage levels; and on the Resource Curse and North Sea Oil
• Research and Analysis on Eurobonds, Minimum Wage Policy, Institutions and the decline of
African Slave States, and the Zambia’s economic reliance on copper
Organizations/ Entrepreneurship
• Madhim Investments: Co-managing an equity portfolio with positions designed to benefit from the
ECB’s QE program
• Dime Limited: Co-founder and managing director of a high-end peer-to-peer clothing marketplace
• Young Democrats: Worked to canvas elections, and wrote editorials about economic policy
• Sustainability Office: Led an effort to start the Next Play, a unique business plan competition that
incorporates both sports and sustainability
